snippet: Under Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal, New York would become the first city in the nation to require stores to keep tobacco products out of sight.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg proposes legislation requiring stores to put cigarettes and other tobacco products out of sight in an effort to shield children from tobacco marketing and people trying to quit from buying on impulse; bill would make New York first city in nation to force retailers to keep tobacco products hidden.

byline.contributor: Michael M. Grynbaum and Meredith Mandell contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Under Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s proposal, New York would become the first city in the nation to require stores to keep tobacco products out of sight.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Bill Would Make Retailers Hide Cigarettes
headline.main: Bloomberg’s Plan Would Make Stores Conceal Cigarettes
headline.print_headline: In New Health Push, Mayor Wants Stores To Keep Cigarettes Out of Public Sight
